code: @Manual{,   title = {seasight: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting},   author = {Philipp Wegm√ºller},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://p-wegmueller.github.io/seasight/}, }

title: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting
text: üîç Seasonality detection & pre-checks Simple helpers detect seasonality, trading-day calendar effects, flag problematic series model estimation. ‚öôÔ∏è Model comparison & selection Compare alternative X-13ARIMA-SEATS specifications based consistent set diagnostics (residual tests, revision metrics, quality indicators). üìä Diagnostics glance Compact summaries, plots tables highlight seasonal adjustment works well ‚Äì . üßæ Reproducible reporting One-shot report generation (R Markdown / HTML) document model choices, diagnostics revision behaviour internal review dissemination. üèõ Made official statistics Focus transparency, stability time documentation revisions, use cases national accounts short-term indicators. Status: seasight active development. user-facing API may still change first CRAN release.

title: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting
text: can install development version reviser GitHub : ```{r, eval = FALSE} remotes::install_github(‚Äúp-wegmueller/seasight‚Äù) ```` package mature, planned released CRAN:

title: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting
text: typical workflow : start raw time series, run seasonal adjustment (via seasonal::seas()), let seasight generate diagnostics short report. (Function names arguments indicative may change package evolves. Use conceptual example now.)
code: library(seasight) library(seasonal)  # Example series (to be adapted to your data) x <- AirPassengers  # Basic seasonal adjustment with 'seasonal' sa_model <- seas(x)  # Summarise diagnostics (function name subject to change) seasight_summary(sa_model) #> Prints a compact overview of key diagnostics  # Create an HTML report for documentation / review seasight_report(sa_model, file = "sa_airpassengers.html") #> Opens a browser with plots, tables and revision metrics

title: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting
text: Quarterly National Accounts: real, nominal deflator series production, expenditure income accounts Short-term indicators: industrial production, retail trade, labour market Internal method reports (re-)design seasonal adjustment strategy Comparing legacy new SA specifications transition periods

title: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting
text: Feedback practitioners highly welcome, especially : statistical offices central banks finance ministries researchers working real-time data revisions Please feel free open issue share ideas additional diagnostics reports useful production.

title: Tools for Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting
text: package released MIT License (see LICENSE).

what: Automatic seasonal analysis (candidate grid + ranking) ‚Äî auto_seasonal_analysis
title: Automatic seasonal analysis (candidate grid + ranking) ‚Äî auto_seasonal_analysis
text: Runs grid X-13ARIMA-SEATS specifications, computes diagnostics (QS tests, residual checks, revision metrics, distance baseline model, etc.), ranks candidates using composite score. Returns best model together diagnostic table seasonality call.

title: Automatic seasonal analysis (candidate grid + ranking) ‚Äî auto_seasonal_analysis
code: auto_seasonal_analysis(   y,   specs = NULL,   use_fivebest = TRUE,   auto_outliers = TRUE,   transform_fun = c("auto", "log", "none"),   td_candidates = NULL,   td_usertype = "td",   include_easter = c("auto", "always", "off"),   easter_len = 15L,   include_history_top_n = 10,   early_period_end = NULL,   current_model = NULL,   current_sa = NULL,   current_seasonal = NULL,   w_qs = 1,   w_stability = 1,   w_aicc = 1,   w_rev = 0.5,   w_dist_sa = 1,   w_dist_seas = 0.5,   w_engine = 1,   engine = c("seats", "x11", "auto"),   outlier_types = c("AO", "LS", "TC"),   outlier_method = "AddOne",   outlier_critical = 4,   outlier_alpha = NULL )

title: Automatic seasonal analysis (candidate grid + ranking) ‚Äî auto_seasonal_analysis
text: y time series (ts) object can converted ts via tsbox::ts_ts(). specs Optional character vector ARIMA specifications form "(p d q)(P D Q)". NULL, default specs chosen based series frequency. use_fivebest Logical. TRUE, small set data-driven "five best" specs (√† la seasonal::seas(x, x11 = "")) added candidate grid. auto_outliers Logical. TRUE, enables automatic outlier detection candidate models. transform_fun Transformation applied input series seasonal adjustment. "auto" selects safe log transform series strictly positive, "log" forces log transform, "none" keeps series levels. td_candidates Optional named list alternative trading-day regressors, e.g. list(wd = wd.m, wd1 = wd1.m). element time series aligned y. td_usertype Character string passed regression.usertype xreg used (default "td"). include_easter Controls inclusion Easter regressors: "auto" (default) lets procedure decide, "always" always includes Easter, "" never includes Easter. logical value also accepted mapped "auto"/"". easter_len Integer, length (days) Easter effect included. include_history_top_n Integer, number top-ranked models revision metrics history computed final ranking step. early_period_end Reserved future use. Optional index date marking end early sample period used stability checks. current_model Optional incumbent seasonal::seas object used baseline distance measures comparison. current_sa Optional baseline seasonally adjusted series. supplied, extracted current_model possible. current_seasonal Optional baseline seasonal component. supplied, extracted current_model (preferring SEATS, falling back X-11 needed). w_qs Weight QS (seasonality) diagnostics composite ranking score. w_stability Weight residual / stability diagnostics (e.g. Ljung-Box) composite score. w_aicc Weight information criterion (AICc) composite score. w_rev Weight revision metric (historical revision MAE) composite score. w_dist_sa Weight distance seasonally adjusted series (candidate vs baseline) composite score. w_dist_seas Weight distance seasonal components (candidate vs baseline) composite score. w_engine Weight / penalty term related decomposition engine (SEATS vs X-11) composite score. engine Engine preference candidate models. One "seats", "x11" "auto" (tries lets ranking decide, small penalty deviations preferred engine). outlier_types Character vector outlier types detect, typically subset c("AO", "LS", "TC"). outlier_method Character scalar giving outlier detection method (passed seasonal::seas(), e.g. "AddOne"). outlier_critical Numeric critical value outlier detection (e.g. t- z-threshold). outlier_alpha Optional numeric significance level outlier detection. supplied, converted two-sided normal cutoff outlier_critical.

title: Automatic seasonal analysis (candidate grid + ranking) ‚Äî auto_seasonal_analysis
text: object class "auto_seasonal_analysis" components best (best seas model), table (diagnostic ranking table), specs_tried, frequency, transform, baseline, seasonality.

what: Extract X-13 outlier coefficients (AO/LS/TC) from a seas model ‚Äî extract_outliers
title: Extract X-13 outlier coefficients (AO/LS/TC) from a seas model ‚Äî extract_outliers
text: Extract X-13 outlier coefficients (AO/LS/TC) seas model

title: Extract X-13 outlier coefficients (AO/LS/TC) from a seas model ‚Äî extract_outliers
Extract X-13 outlier coefficients (AO/LS/TC) from a seas model ‚Äî extract_outliers
text: m fitted seasonal::seas model.

title: Extract X-13 outlier coefficients (AO/LS/TC) from a seas model ‚Äî extract_outliers
text: tibble columns type, period, coef. Empty none found.

title: Comparison wrapper (current vs best) ‚Äî sa_compare
text: Thin wrapper around compare_to_current() returning result. compare_to_current() found, informative error raised.

title: Comparison wrapper (current vs best) ‚Äî sa_compare
Comparison wrapper (current vs best) ‚Äî sa_compare
text: res Result auto_seasonal_analysis(). current_model fitted seas object compare .

title: Comparison wrapper (current vs best) ‚Äî sa_compare
text: List decision, summary, aligned SA/seasonal series.

what: Build a copy-pasteable seas() call from a fitted model ‚Äî sa_copyable_call
title: Build a copy-pasteable seas() call from a fitted model ‚Äî sa_copyable_call
text: SEATS (default engine) ‚Üí omit x11/seats args X-11 ‚Üí include x11 = ""

title: Build a copy-pasteable seas() call from a fitted model ‚Äî sa_copyable_call
code: sa_copyable_call(   m,   x_expr,   xreg_expr = NA,   include_force = FALSE,   engine = c("auto", "seats", "x11") )

title: Build a copy-pasteable seas() call from a fitted model ‚Äî sa_copyable_call
text: m Fitted seas model. x_expr Character code x= (e.g. "y"). xreg_expr NULL drop, NA keep -, character code set. include_force Logical; TRUE adds force.type = "denton". engine "auto" (use model's engine) force "seats"/"x11".

title: Build a copy-pasteable seas() call from a fitted model ‚Äî sa_copyable_call
text: single string containing seas(...) call.

what: Engine choice rationale card (SEATS vs X-11) ‚Äî sa_engine_choice_card
title: Engine choice rationale card (SEATS vs X-11) ‚Äî sa_engine_choice_card
text: Explains‚Äîplain language‚Äîselected engine chosen best model.

title: Engine choice rationale card (SEATS vs X-11) ‚Äî sa_engine_choice_card
Engine choice rationale card (SEATS vs X-11) ‚Äî sa_engine_choice_card
text: res Object auto_seasonal_analysis().

title: Engine choice rationale card (SEATS vs X-11) ‚Äî sa_engine_choice_card
text: htmltools tag (card).

what: Aggregate existence-of-seasonality decision (ADJUST / BORDERLINE / DO_NOT_ADJUST) ‚Äî sa_existence_call
title: Aggregate existence-of-seasonality decision (ADJUST / BORDERLINE / DO_NOT_ADJUST) ‚Äî sa_existence_call
text: Uses IDS, M7 (strong/weak), QS SA, QS ORIGINAL (QSori) form simple majority-style decision. Thresholds mirror used elsewhere.

title: Aggregate existence-of-seasonality decision (ADJUST / BORDERLINE / DO_NOT_ADJUST) ‚Äî sa_existence_call
code: sa_existence_call(   tbl,   majority = 0.6,   thr = list(qs = 0.1, m7_strong = 0.9, m7_weak = 1.05, borderline_min_share = 0.4,     use_qsori = TRUE) )

title: Aggregate existence-of-seasonality decision (ADJUST / BORDERLINE / DO_NOT_ADJUST) ‚Äî sa_existence_call
text: tbl Candidate table (e.g., res$table). majority Required share positive overall call (default 0.6). thr List thresholds: qs (0.10), m7_strong (0.90), m7_weak (1.05), borderline_min_share (0.4), use_qsori (TRUE).

title: Aggregate existence-of-seasonality decision (ADJUST / BORDERLINE / DO_NOT_ADJUST) ‚Äî sa_existence_call
text: tibble call_overall shares per test family.

title: Existence-of-seasonality narrative (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_existence_card
text: Uses IDS, M7, QS original, presence/absence SEATS seasonal component provide short textual assessment seasonality best model.

title: Existence-of-seasonality narrative (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_existence_card
Existence-of-seasonality narrative (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_existence_card
text: res Result auto_seasonal_analysis().

title: Existence-of-seasonality narrative (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_existence_card
text: htmltools tag representing card.

title: Row-level non-adjustment rule (wrapper) ‚Äî sa_is_do_not_adjust
text: Delegates internal .do_not_adjust() keep logic one place.

title: Row-level non-adjustment rule (wrapper) ‚Äî sa_is_do_not_adjust
Row-level non-adjustment rule (wrapper) ‚Äî sa_is_do_not_adjust
text: row One-row tibble res$table.

title: Row-level non-adjustment rule (wrapper) ‚Äî sa_is_do_not_adjust
text: TRUE row satisfies "adjust" rule, FALSE otherwise.

what: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html
title: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html
text: User-facing wrapper runs automatic seasonal analysis writes human-readable HTML report plots, tables, diagnostics, copy-pasteable seas() calls.

title: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html
code: sa_report_html(   y,   current_model = NULL,   td_usertype = "td",   td_candidates = NULL,   use_fivebest = TRUE,   title = "Seasonal Adjustment Report",   outfile = "sa_report.html",   png_width = 1400,   png_height = 900,   print_to_console = FALSE,   print_which = c("new", "current", "both"),   include_easter = c("auto", "always", "off"),   easter_len = 15L,   engine = c("seats", "x11", "auto"),   w_engine = 1,   outlier_types = c("AO", "LS", "TC"),   outlier_method = "AddOne",   outlier_critical = 4,   outlier_alpha = NULL )

title: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html
text: y Time series analysed. Can ts object anything tsbox::ts_ts() can convert ts. current_model Optional incumbent seasonal::seas() model compare newly selected specification. td_usertype Character string passed regression.usertype trading-day regressors used (default "td"). td_candidates Optional named list trading-day candidate regressors (e.g. list(wd = wd.m, wd1 = wd1.m)), aligned y. use_fivebest Logical. TRUE, include ‚Äúfive best‚Äù automatic specs candidate grid. title Title report shown HTML page. outfile Path HTML file written. png_width, png_height Width height (pixels) PNG plots embedded report. print_to_console Logical. TRUE, create HTML file print copy-pasteable model code console return . print_which code blocks print print_to_console = TRUE. One "new", "current" "". include_easter Controls inclusion Easter regressors: "auto" (default) lets selector decide, "always" always includes Easter, "" never includes Easter. logical value also accepted mapped "auto"/"". easter_len Integer, length (days) Easter effect included. engine Preferred decomposition engine candidate models. One "seats", "x11" "auto". w_engine Numeric weight engine choice component composite ranking score. outlier_types Character vector outlier types detect, typically subset c("AO", "LS", "TC"). outlier_method Character scalar giving outlier detection method passed seasonal::seas() (e.g. "AddOne"). outlier_critical Numeric critical value outlier detection (e.g. t-/z-threshold). outlier_alpha Optional numeric significance level; supplied, converted two-sided normal cutoff outlier_critical.

title: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html
text: Invisibly, list elements report (path HTML file) res (corresponding auto_seasonal_analysis() result).

title: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html
text: Notes: provided current specification equals selected best model, report omits ‚ÄúAlternative model‚Äù comparison section. ‚ÄúTop candidates‚Äù table starts best model always includes current model (flagged ‚≠ê) one supplied.

title: Seasonal Adjustment: full HTML report ‚Äî sa_report_html

what: Should we switch to the new best model? ‚Äî sa_should_switch
title: Should we switch to the new best model? ‚Äî sa_should_switch
text: switch new best model?

title: Should we switch to the new best model? ‚Äî sa_should_switch
code: sa_should_switch(   res,   thresholds = list(min_qs_p = 0.1, max_dist_sa_mult = 1.25, min_corr_seas = 0.9,     min_lb_p = 0.05) )

title: Should we switch to the new best model? ‚Äî sa_should_switch
text: res Result auto_seasonal_analysis(). thresholds Named list decision thresholds: min_qs_p: minimum acceptable QS p-value SA (overall) best model max_dist_sa_mult: allow SA L1 distance multiple cross-candidate median min_corr_seas: minimum correlation seasonal components (vs. incumbent) min_lb_p: minimum acceptable Ljung‚ÄìBox p-value residuals

title: Should we switch to the new best model? ‚Äî sa_should_switch
text: One "CHANGE_TO_NEW_MODEL" "KEEP_CURRENT_MODEL".

what: Key seasonality diagnostics for a fitted model ‚Äî sa_tests_model
title: Key seasonality diagnostics for a fitted model ‚Äî sa_tests_model
text: Returns M7, IDS, QS SA (X-11 & SEATS, plus overall min), QS original (X-11 & SEATS, plus overall min), Ljung‚ÄìBox p-value residuals.

title: Key seasonality diagnostics for a fitted model ‚Äî sa_tests_model
Key seasonality diagnostics for a fitted model ‚Äî sa_tests_model
text: m fitted seasonal::seas object.

title: Key seasonality diagnostics for a fitted model ‚Äî sa_tests_model
text: one-row tibble columns: M7, IDS, QS_p_x11, QS_p_seats, QS_p, QSori_p_x11, QSori_p_seats, QSori_p, LB_p.

title: Top candidates table (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_top_candidates_table
text: Build colour-coded HTML table highest-ranked candidate models, always placing best model top including current model (supplied) even top n. airline reference model ARIMA (0 1 1)(0 1 1) also appended absent.

title: Top candidates table (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_top_candidates_table
code: sa_top_candidates_table(res, current_model = NULL, y = NULL, n = 5)

title: Top candidates table (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_top_candidates_table
text: res Result auto_seasonal_analysis(). current_model Optional fitted seasonal::seas model mark "current". y Optional original series (needed compute current-model diagnostics). n Number top rows display (default 5). airline/current rows may appended even top n.

title: Top candidates table (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_top_candidates_table
text: htmltools tag (<table>) can insert reports.

title: Top candidates table (HTML tag) ‚Äî sa_top_candidates_table
text: Rows lightly shaded: ‚úÖ best (green), ‚≠ê current (blue), airline (red).

what: seasight: Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting ‚Äî seasight
title: seasight: Seasonal Adjustment Diagnostics and Reporting ‚Äî seasight
text: Tools running comparing X-13ARIMA-SEATS specifications, ranking diagnostics, generating HTML reports.
